source_sentence: 佛說光明童子因緣經卷第一
translation: Foshuo fongguangming gongzi yining jing, vol. 1

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大
translation: translated scriptures from the Western Heaven into Chinese by the Tripiṭaka Master Samzang朝奉大

source_sentence: 夫試光祿卿傳法大師
translation: Fu xiang luqing zhuanfa dashi

source_sentence: 賜紫臣施護奉　詔譯
translation: He was given the imperial edict to bestow upon the purple minister, Shi Hufeng.

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，佛在王舍城，迦蘭陀竹林精舍。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Kalandaka’s Bamboo Grove Monastery in Rājagaha.

source_sentence: 而彼城中，有一長者，名曰善賢，有大財寶富饒自在，然彼長者，於諸外道尼乾陀等，
translation: In that city, however, there was an elderly man named Sunetra, who had great wealth and possessions and lived freely.

source_sentence: 深生信重。
translation: He deeply believed in it.

source_sentence: 長者一時，以彼世因緣故，其妻懷妊。
translation: One time, the elder's wife was pregnant because of the causes and conditions of that world.

source_sentence: 而後一日，世尊於其食時，被袈裟衣，執持應器，入王舍城，次第乞食，
translation: One day, when the World-honored One was about to eat, he put on his monastic robes, took his almsbowl in hand, and entered Rājagaha to solicit almsfood one by one.

source_sentence: 漸次至彼善賢長者舍。
translation: Gradually, he went to that house of the elder Shanxian.

source_sentence: 時彼長者，遠見世尊漸近自舍，即謂妻言：「我今同汝，詣世尊所。」
translation: Seeing the Bhagavān from a distance, the elder then gradually approached his own house and said to his wife, Now, I'll go with you to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 作是言已，即與其妻，前詣佛所。
translation: Having said these words, he gave them to his wife and went before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 到已白言：「世尊！
translation: When he arrived, he said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我名善賢，此是我妻，其人懷妊，日月將滿，當所生者，是男？
translation: I am called Shanxian, and this is my wife. That woman will be pregnant for the full duration of a month. Will she give birth to a boy?

source_sentence: 是女？」
translation: Is this woman?

source_sentence: 佛言：「長者！
translation: The Buddha said, Elder!

source_sentence: 汝妻胎中，決定是男，其後生已，家族富盛，最上吉祥，現於人中受天勝福，
translation: Your wife will surely be a male in the womb. When she is born later, her family will be prosperous and most auspicious. She will now experience heavenly bliss among humans.

source_sentence: 乃至最後，於我法中出家學道，斷諸煩惱，證阿羅漢。」
translation: At the end, he leaves home and trains on the path in my teaching, stops afflictions, and realizes arhatship.

source_sentence: 是時長者，即取滿鉢上味清淨飲食，奉上世尊。
translation: The elder then took the bowl full of food and drink, which was pure and delicious, and offered it to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊受已，作如是言：「願其施者，吉祥安樂。」
translation: After accepting it, the Bhagavān said, May his donor be auspicious and comfortable.

source_sentence: 世尊言已，持所施食，還復本處。
translation: After the Bhagavān had said this, he returned to his original place with the food he had given.

source_sentence: 佛去未遠，有一外道，是彼善賢先所重者，見佛世尊已，即作是思惟：「豈非今時因此沙門瞿曇，
translation: Not far from the Buddha, however, there was a heretic who had been esteemed by that good man. Seeing the World-honored One, he thought:

source_sentence: 長者於我破本信心，我宜往彼詢問其故，沙門瞿曇來何所說？」
translation: The elder has destroyed his original faith in me, so I should go there to ask him about it. What did the ascetic Gautama say?

source_sentence: 時彼外道，作是思惟已，即詣長者舍，作如是言：「長者！
translation: After he had this thought, that non-Buddhist went to the elder's house and said, Elder!

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇有何願求，來至汝舍？
translation: “World-honored One, what is the wish of the renunciant Gotama to come to your house?

source_sentence: 復作何說？」
translation: What do you say again?

source_sentence: 長者白言：「我師聖者！
translation: The elder said, My teacher, the noble one!

source_sentence: 我妻懷妊故，乃問彼沙門瞿曇，當所生者，是男？
translation: Because my wife was pregnant, I asked that ascetic Gautama, 'Is the man who will be born here a man?'

source_sentence: 是女？
translation: This is a woman!

source_sentence: 彼謂我言：『定當生男，生已決定家族富盛，最上吉祥，現於人中，受天勝福，
translation: They said to me, “A boy will surely be born. His family will certainly be prosperous after he is born. He will be the most auspicious and appear among humans to receive heavenly blessings.

source_sentence: 乃至最後於我法中，出家學道證阿羅漢。』」
translation: It's even the last time he leaves home and trains in the path to realize arhatship in my teaching.'

source_sentence: 而此外道，本善占相，聞是言已，即取白石，施設算法，算量其事為虛為實。
translation: Hearing these words, he took the white stone and created an arithmetic to calculate whether it was false or true.

source_sentence: 彼設算已，具知其事，如佛所言，實無虛妄。
translation: After they had calculated it, they knew all about it, just as the Buddha said, which is true and not false.

source_sentence: 而彼外道，雖知其實，然作是念：「我今若以如實而說，即此長者於彼沙門瞿曇，
translation: Although the heretic knew the true facts, he thought: “If I now tell them the truth, then this wealthy householder [would have] said to that renunciant Gotama,

source_sentence: 定生信重，我今宜應語長者言：『瞿曇所說有實有虛。』」
translation: Concentration gives rise to faith, so now it's appropriate for me to say to the elderly man, 'There's a real and a falsehood in what Gautama teaches.'

source_sentence: 時彼外道，作是念已，呼長者妻，近外道前，取左右手，復看手文，及瞻面相。
translation: After he had this thought, that non-Buddhist called the elder's wife and went to the front of the non-Buddhist, took his left and right hands, looked at the sign on his hand, and looked at his face.

source_sentence: 爾時善賢長者，即白外道言：「我師聖者！
translation: It was then that the well-versed elder said to the non-Buddhist, My teacher, noble one!

source_sentence: 先已設算。
translation: We've already done the calculation.

source_sentence: 何故重復看其手文及瞻面相？」
translation: Why is it that you're again looking at the shape of his hand and the characteristics of his face?

source_sentence: 彼外道言：「我適算彼瞿曇所說，及相汝妻，審知其事，少分真實，少分虛妄。」
translation: The non-Buddhist said, It's appropriate for me to calculate what that Gautama teaches and tell you about your wife so as to know that it's partially true and partially false.

source_sentence: 長者復言：「何者真實？
translation: The elder again said, What's real?

source_sentence: 何者虛妄？」
translation: What's false?

source_sentence: 外道答言：「瞿曇所說汝妻生男，此說是實；
translation: The heretic replied, “Gautama teaches that your wife gave birth to a boy.

source_sentence: 所言生已家族富盛，此亦是實。
translation: The claim that his family is wealthy after he's born is also true.

source_sentence: 然子生時，合有少分火光明事，此子後必壞汝家族，所言最上吉祥，現於人中受天勝福，
translation: But when your child is born, there will be a light from a small part of the fire. This child will surely destroy your family. What you call supremely auspicious will now appear among humans and receive heavenly blessedness.

source_sentence: 此是虛妄。
translation: This is false.

source_sentence: 長者！
translation: Elder!

source_sentence: 汝豈曾聞於人世中受天福者，斯為難信，所言於瞿曇法中當出家者，此說是實，
translation: Have you ever heard that in the human world one receives heavenly blessings? This is hard to believe. What you say will be a renunciant of the householder’s life according to the [Buddhist] law of the Gautama, but this theory is correct.

source_sentence: 以彼衣食因緣所逼切故，而後決定於瞿曇邊樂求出家。
translation: Because they are oppressed by the causes and conditions of food and clothing, they're later determined to happily seek renunciation at the side of Gautama.

source_sentence: 所言斷諸煩惱證阿羅漢者，此是虛妄，以沙門瞿曇法中，決定無有斷諸煩惱，
translation: Those who claim that they have cut off all the defilements and realized arhatship are false. Because, according to the teachings of the śramaṇa Gautama, there is absolutely no cutting off of all defilements.

source_sentence: 證聖果者。」
translation: He who realizes the noble fruit.

source_sentence: 爾時善賢長者，聞說是事，若虛若實，其心疑惑，即生愁惱，白外道言：「我師聖者！
translation: When the well-versed elder heard this teaching, whether false or true, his mind doubted and became sad, and he said to the non-Buddhist monk, My teacher, noble one!

source_sentence: 其事云何？
translation: What's the matter?

source_sentence: 我今宜應當何所作？」
translation: What should I do now?

source_sentence: 外道告言：「長者當令汝子生後，於我教中出家修學，即能普學一切事業。
translation: The non-Buddhist said, Sir, you should allow your son to leave home and train in my teaching after he's born, so that he can study all the tasks.

source_sentence: 長者！
translation: Elder!

source_sentence: 我雖此說，汝自籌量。」
translation: Even though I say this, you should judge for yourself.

source_sentence: 時彼外道作是言已，即出其舍。
translation: After he said this, the non-Buddhist left his house.

source_sentence: 是時，善賢長者靜在一處，審自思惟：「我今一切不能顧惜而悉棄捨，
translation: At that time, the wealthy householder Shanxian was still in one place. He thought to himself:

source_sentence: 宜設計謀壞所妊子。」
translation: It's better to design a plan to destroy the child you're pregnant with.

source_sentence: 作是思惟已，善賢長者即持毒藥，塗摩妻腹。
translation: After he had this thought, the elder Sunetra then took the poisonous medicine and rubbed it on his wife's belly.

source_sentence: 是時，長者左邊摩藥，子轉右邊，右邊摩藥，子轉左邊，乃至遍腹，無處容受，
translation: At that time, the wealthy man touched the medicine on his left side. The child turned to the right side and rubbed the medicine on his right side. As the child turned to the left side, it reached all over his abdomen; there was no place to put it.

source_sentence: 塗摩毒藥，其妻以故，即趣命終。
translation: He rubbed it on a poisonous medicine, and because of this his wife died.

source_sentence: 善賢意謂：「母既命終，子亦隨滅，而後無人壞我家族，亦復無人得證聖果。」
translation: Shanxian thought, After his mother dies, the child also follows her death, but there's no one after that who breaks up my family or realizes the noble fruit.

source_sentence: 爾時長者，既見其妻已趣命終，即時涕淚號泣。
translation: Seeing that his wife was about to die, the elder then wept and cried in tears.

source_sentence: 隣人親屬，來相慰問善賢長者：「汝妻何以忽然命終？」
translation: The neighbors and relatives came to comfort the elder Sunetra, asking, Why did your wife suddenly die?

source_sentence: 長者報言：「因懷妊故，而忽命終。」
translation: The elder replied, My life suddenly ended because I was pregnant.

source_sentence: 親屬隣人來相問已，各還自舍。
translation: After their relatives and neighbors came to ask questions, they each returned to their own house.

source_sentence: 善賢長者即自思惟：「我妻已歿，勿置家中，可為施設諸所用物，送尸陀林。」
translation: The good and virtuous elder then thought to himself, My wife has been deceived, so don't leave her at home; you should prepare things for her use and send them to the cemetery.

source_sentence: 作是思惟已，即為備辦所用諸物，將欲出送。
translation: After he had this thought, he prepared the things he wanted to use and was about to leave.

source_sentence: 隣人親屬知己，復來謂長者言：「汝妻已歿，不須啼泣徒自生惱。」
translation: Knowing himself, the neighbors and relatives of his family came back and said to the elder, Your wife has been married, so you don't need to weep or wail to cause yourself trouble.

source_sentence: 是時，長者即取青、黃、赤白眾色衣服，及珍寶具，而為莊嚴，長者即時與諸親屬，
translation: The wealthy man then took the blue, yellow, red, and white clothes of various colors and adorned them with rare treasures.

source_sentence: 圍繞出送，置尸陀林。
translation: Surrounded by the monks, they came out to escort the image and placed it in the cemetery.

source_sentence: 爾時先占相者，外道尼乾陀，知是事已，心大歡喜，即持幢蓋，嚴飾而行。
translation: Knowing this, the non-Buddhist Nirgrantha, who had previously divined the signs, was greatly delighted. He carried a banner and canopy over his head, adorned himself well, and departed.

source_sentence: 於王舍城，周遍巷陌四衢道中，告諸外道尼乾陀等言：「汝等知不？
translation: In the city of Rājagṛha, he pervaded the four corners of the streets and told the non-Buddhist Nirgranthas and others, Do you know?

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇先言：『善賢長者妻當生子，其後生已，家族富盛，最上吉祥，
translation: The śramaṇa Gautama had said previously, “The wife of the wealthy merchant Sudarśana will give birth to a son. When he is born thereafter, his family will be prosperous and most auspicious.

source_sentence: 現於人中受天勝福乃至最後，於我法中出家學道，斷諸煩惱，證阿羅漢。』
translation: Now, among humans, they'll receive heavenly superior merits up to the end, leave home in my teaching, train in the path, cut off afflictions, and realize arhatship.'

source_sentence: 彼虛妄說，今善賢妻，已趣命終，子亦隨滅。
translation: They falsely say, Now that Shanxian's wife is about to die, the child will also perish.

source_sentence: 汝等當知，譬如大樹，根既斷壞，枝葉華果，其何能得？」
translation: You should know that it's like a great tree whose roots have been cut off, and how can its branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits be obtained?

source_sentence: 諸外道輩，相言告已，心皆歡喜。
translation: The non-Buddhist monks told each other, and they all rejoiced.

source_sentence: 諸有清淨信者，當知佛世尊者法爾真實，無所不知，無所不見，無所不解，
translation: Those who have pure faith should know that the teachings of the Buddha, the World-honored One, are true and genuine. There is nothing they do not know, nothing they do not see, and nothing they do not understand.

source_sentence: 無所不了，起大悲心，普攝世間。
translation: Nothing can be comprehended, and the mind of great compassion arises to embrace all worlds.

source_sentence: 作一護念，施一無畏，已能圓滿止觀二行，已能成就三調伏事，已渡四流煩惱大海，
translation: Having perfected the two practices of calming and insight, having accomplished the three disciplines, and having crossed the four great rivers of affliction,

source_sentence: 已能安住四神足行，以四攝法，普攝眾生。
translation: Having been able to abide in the practice of the four supernormal powers, he embraced sentient beings everywhere by means of the four methods of salvation.

source_sentence: 於長夜中，常念度脫，已能成就四無所畏，斷五分結，已出五趣，六法具足，
translation: Throughout the long night, he’s always mindful of his liberation. He’s already accomplished the four fearlessnesses, cut off the five fetters, left the five realms of rebirth, and is endowed with the six dharmas.

source_sentence: 六波羅蜜，悉皆圓滿，具足六種佛常行法，開七覺華，成八正果，成就三摩鉢底，
translation: The six transcendent ways were all perfected, fully endowed with the six kinds of Buddha’s constant practice; they bloomed the flowers of enlightenment and attained the eightfold true fruit. They perfected samāpatti.

source_sentence: 九先行善，十力堅固，名稱普聞十方世界。
translation: Nine, they're preceded by goodness, the ten powers are resolute, and their reputation is universally heard in the worlds of the ten directions.

source_sentence: 具足千種最勝自在，於日三時及夜三時，常以佛眼，觀察世間，正知見轉於眾生中，
translation: They are endowed with one thousand kinds of supreme freedom. At the three times of the day and at the three times of the night, they always observe the world with the eye of buddhahood, correctly knowing and seeing all things in sentient beings.

source_sentence: 諸所施作。
translation: What's given is made.

source_sentence: 何處若有增？
translation: Where is there an increase?

source_sentence: 何處若有減？
translation: Where is there a decrease?

source_sentence: 何處若煩惱？
translation: Where are the afflictions?

source_sentence: 何處受極苦？
translation: Where will they experience extreme pain?

source_sentence: 何處若破壞？
translation: Where will it be destroyed?

source_sentence: 何處具有煩惱極苦破壞等事？
translation: Where is there such a thing as the destruction of affliction and extreme suffering?

source_sentence: 何處施設少分方便？
translation: Where is a little bit of skillful means defined?

source_sentence: 何處施設大方便力？
translation: Where is the great power of skillful means established?

source_sentence: 何處施設諸方便事？
translation: Where are the tasks of skillful means defined?

source_sentence: 何處眾生墮於惡趣？
translation: Where will sentient beings fall into bad destinies?

source_sentence: 何處眾生得生天界？
translation: Where can sentient beings be born in the heavenly realm?

source_sentence: 何處眾生得解脫果？
translation: Where will sentient beings attain the fruit of liberation?

source_sentence: 何處眾生未種善根者？
translation: Where are sentient beings who haven't planted good roots?

source_sentence: 令種善根。
translation: It causes them to plant good roots.

source_sentence: 何處眾生已種善根者？
translation: Where are sentient beings who have planted good roots?

source_sentence: 使令成熟。
translation: It causes them to mature.

source_sentence: 何處眾生已成熟者？
translation: Where are the sentient beings who have matured?

source_sentence: 令得解脫。
translation: He causes them to attain liberation.

source_sentence: 佛世尊者，具足如是功德，言無虛妄，離諸過失。
translation: Bhagavān, the Buddha is endowed with such virtue, speaks without falsehood, and is free of faults.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，審知時處因緣等事，知其所應放光明時，即從口中，出現青、黃、赤白眾色光明，
translation: At that time the World-honored One, knowing well the causes and conditions of each condition, knew what should be emitted. Then blue, yellow, red, white, and various other forms of light appeared from his mouth.

source_sentence: 其光周遍，上下照耀。
translation: The light pervaded everywhere and shone brightly above and below.

source_sentence: 光下照時，所有等活地獄，黑繩地獄、眾合地獄、號叫地獄、大號叫地獄、炎熱地獄、極炎熱地獄、阿鼻地獄，
translation: When the light shines downward, all the hells that are similarly alive are black-rope hells, assemblies hells, screaming hells, wailing hells, great wailing hells, scorching hells, extreme scorching hells, and avīci hells.

source_sentence: 如是等八熱地獄，光明照已，悉變清涼。
translation: These eight hot hells, having been illumined by the ray of light, all become clear and cool.

source_sentence: 所有皰地獄、皰裂地獄、阿吒吒地獄、呵呵鑁地獄、虎虎鑁地獄、青蓮華地獄、紅蓮華地獄、大紅蓮華地獄，
translation: They abide in blistering hell, blistering hell, blistering hell, aṭaṭa hell, haṭṭika hell, tiger hell, blue lotus hell, red lotus hell, and great red lotus hell.

source_sentence: 如是等八寒地獄，光明照已，悉變溫暖，以佛光明最勝因故。
translation: These eight cold hells, having been illumined by the Buddha’s ray of light, all become warm: this is due to the predominant cause of the Buddha’s ray of light.

source_sentence: 其中眾生，蒙光照觸，身得離苦，心生適悅，各作是言：「我等以何罪因，
translation: The sentient beings therein were illumined and touched by the light, and their bodies were freed from suffering. Each felt pleased and said, “What is the cause of our sins?

source_sentence: 墮在此中？
translation: Do you fall into this?

source_sentence: 今日覩是希有光明。」
translation: Today, this is a rare ray of light.

source_sentence: 地獄眾生，發起如是清淨心時，世尊大悲，復於光中，現變化事。
translation: When the sentient beings in hell give rise to such a pure mind, the Bhagavān with great compassion again manifests miraculous deeds in the light.

source_sentence: 彼諸眾生，見所化已，又作是言：「我等今日見是變化希有等相，此處出已，
translation: Those sentient beings saw the magical emanation and said, “Today we see such extraordinary signs of transformation as these.

source_sentence: 應不復於惡趣受生，以佛光明最勝因緣故，身離苦惱，心生適悅。」
translation: You should no longer be born in a bad destiny, and because of the most excellent causes and conditions for the Buddha's light, your body is freed from suffering and distress, and your mind becomes comfortable.

source_sentence: 作是言已，各發最上清淨信心，彼地獄業，皆悉滅盡，即分人天二趣受生。
translation: Having said this, each of them aroused the supreme pure faith that their actions in those hells would all cease, which would mean they'd be born in the two destinies of humans and gods.

source_sentence: 地獄眾生，由是真實，如應得利已，是佛光明，又復上照四大王天、忉利天、夜摩天、兜率天、化樂天、他化自在天、梵眾天、梵輔天、大梵天、少光天、無量光天、光音天、少淨天、無量淨天、遍淨天、無雲天、福生天、廣果天、無煩天、無熱天、善見天、善現天、色究竟天。
translation: Because of this reality, the sentient beings in hell will receive their benefits as they should be. This is the Buddha’s ray of light that illuminates the four great heavenly kings, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yama gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the Brahma

source_sentence: 「譬如大象沒泥中，　　以勇力故即能出，
translation: “Suppose a great elephant is submerged in mud And, by the power of courage, emerges.

source_sentence: 佛教勇猛大力故，　　能令生死軍摧壞。
translation: Because of Buddhism’s boldness and great power, They can cause the armies of birth and death to be destroyed.

source_sentence: 今此正法善調伏，　　所行遠離諸過失，
translation: This is the right teaching that’s well disciplined, free of faults and errors in what they practice.

source_sentence: 息彼三界廣輪迴，　　滅盡眾生苦邊際。」
translation: He stops the wide transmigration of the three realms and extinguishes the limits of suffering for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 光明上照如是等天已，於其光中，演出無常苦空無我之聲，復於光中說伽陀曰：爾時世尊所放光明，
translation: Having illumined such gods with their light, they produced the sound of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and non-self in their light. Again, he spoke these verses: At that time the Buddha emitted this ray of light:

source_sentence: 各各隨往，乃至遍照三千大千世界。
translation: Each one follows the other, up to the point where it universally illuminates 3,000 great one-thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 而佛世尊，雖放一光，其光收時，隨應各異：世尊若欲說過去事，其光即當從佛後隱；
translation: The Buddha, the World-honored One, though emitting a single ray of light, when that light disappears it varies according to what is appropriate: if the World-honored One wishes to explain the events of the past, his light will be hidden behind the Buddha.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼未來世事，其光即當從佛前隱；
translation: If you want to tell me about the events of future ages, that light will be hidden in front of Buddha.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼地獄趣事，其光即從佛足心隱；
translation: If they want to tell the story of the hells, their light follows the Buddha’s footsteps and is concealed in their minds.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼傍生趣事，其光即從佛足面隱；
translation: If they want to tell the story of the rebirths of those animals, their light disappears from the Buddha’s feet and face.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼餓鬼趣事，其光即從佛足指隱；
translation: If they want to tell the story of the rebirths of those hungry ghosts, their light disappears from the Buddha’s feet.

source_sentence: 若欲說於人趣中事，其光即當從佛膝隱；
translation: If you want to explain the matter of human destinies, that light will be hidden from the Buddha’s knees.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼小轉輪王事，其光從佛左手心隱；
translation: If one wishes to expound the deeds of a minor universal ruler, that light is concealed from the mind on the Buddha’s left hand.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼大轉輪王事，其光從佛右手心隱；
translation: If one wishes to expound the deeds of the universal ruler, that light emanates from the Buddha’s right hand and is concealed in his mind.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼天趣中事，其光即當從佛臍隱；
translation: If you wish to explain the events in those heavenly realms, that light will be hidden from the Buddha’s navel.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼聲聞菩提，其光即當從佛口隱；
translation: If you want to explain the enlightenment of those disciples, that light will be hidden from the Buddha’s mouth.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼緣覺菩提，其光即當從佛眉隱；
translation: If you want to explain the enlightenment of those pratyekabuddhas, that light will follow the Buddha’s brows.

source_sentence: 若欲說彼阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，其光從佛頂門而隱。
translation: If someone wants to explain that unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, their light hides at the Buddha's top of the head.

source_sentence: 今佛世尊所放光明，遍照三千大千世界已，其光旋環，却從世尊口中而隱。
translation: Now the Buddha, the World-honored One, has emanated a ray of light that pervades the great manifold cosmos. Having thus illumined the universe containing the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds, his ray of light circled around it and disappeared from within the mouth of the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 爾時尊者阿難，先侍佛邊，見此光明，即前合掌白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, Venerable Ānanda, who had previously attended the Buddha's side, saw this light and joined his palms and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此種種妙色最上清淨光明，從佛口出，廣大照耀，普遍世界，以何因緣，
translation: “These various subtle forms and the supremely pure light of all kinds now emerge from the Buddha’s mouth, shining vastly and brilliantly. What is the reason for this?

source_sentence: 其事如是？」
translation: Is this the way it is?

source_sentence: 「佛於世間為最上，　　安住正因而真實，
translation: The Buddha is supreme in the world, Abiding correctly and truly.

source_sentence: 久已遠離二語言，　　斷除憍慢等過失。
translation: Having for a long time been far removed from the two kinds of speech, they have eliminated such faults as arrogance.

source_sentence: 如世商佉及蓮藕，　　非無因故色自白，
translation: Like worldly merchandise and lotus blossoms, Their color is not white for no reason.

source_sentence: 如來最勝人中尊，　　非無因故光明現。
translation: The Tathāgata is the most distinguished among humans, not because it doesn't show light without a cause.

source_sentence: 如來以自行願力，　　現證神通及大智，
translation: The Enlightened One, by the power of his own vows and self-power, Is manifesting mystic knowledge and great knowledge.

source_sentence: 觀察聽者樂聞法，　　佛人中主欲敷演。
translation: Observing listeners who delight in hearing the teaching, the Buddha's lord among humans wants to expound it.

source_sentence: 大智寂默大牛王，　　必說最上妙法語，
translation: The great wise and silent Great Ox King Will surely expound the supremely sublime teaching.

source_sentence: 如來清淨一音宣，　　眾生疑網皆除斷；
translation: The Buddha’s pure one-voice proclamation removes all sentient beings’ webs of doubt.

source_sentence: 又如大海及山王，　　若無因故不能動，
translation: Again, just as the great ocean and the king of mountains Cannot move without a cause:

source_sentence: 如來正覺人中尊，　　無因不現光明相。
translation: The Tathāgata, the correctly enlightened one, honored among men, doesn't show his radiant appearance without a reason.

source_sentence: 大智觀察因緣事，　　如應所作皆利益，
translation: Great knowledge observes causes and conditions for all things, doing whatever should be done for their benefit.

source_sentence: 隨諸眾生所希望，　　故現如是光明相。」
translation: According to the wishes of sentient beings, they therefore show such a ray of light.

source_sentence: 作是語已，即說伽陀曰：爾時，世尊告阿難言：「如是！
translation: After he said this, he spoke to Gadha, saying, At that point, the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 阿難當知，如來、應供、正等正覺，若無因緣，不放光明。
translation: Ānanda, you should know that the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One do not emit light if there is no cause for it.

source_sentence: 我今將欲詣尸陀林，汝可往告諸苾芻眾，謂言：『如來將詣尸陀林中，
translation: I now wish to go to the cemetery. Go tell the monks and nuns, saying:

source_sentence: 汝諸苾芻發勤勇者，如應各各被袈裟衣，侍從如來，往尸陀林。』」
translation: Those of you monks who have arisen from diligence and courage should each put on the reddish-brown robes, serve the Tathāgata, and go to the cemetery.'

source_sentence: 是時，阿難受佛教勅，即詣諸苾芻所，到已作如是言：「佛勅諸苾芻，
translation: At that time, having received the Buddha’s instructions, Ānanda approached the bhikṣus. Having arrived there, he said:

source_sentence: 如來將詣尸陀林中，汝諸苾芻發勤勇者，如應各各被袈裟衣，侍從如來，
translation: When the Tathāgata is about to enter the cemetery, all of you bhikṣus who have aroused such diligence and courage should dress yourselves in the yellow robes and attend the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 往尸陀林。」
translation: Go to the cemetery.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者阿若憍陳如、馬勝、嚩澁波、大名、跋捺哩迦、舍利子、目乾連、迦葉、滿稱等，
translation: At that time, venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya, Maudgalyāyana, Upagupta, Mahāprajāpa, Mahamaṇa, Upankara, Śāriputra, Mucilinda, Kāśyapa, Samantanetra, and so forth.

source_sentence: 諸大聲聞眾，受佛勅已，即如常儀，被袈裟衣，來至佛所。
translation: The great śrāvakas, having received the Buddha’s edict, came to the place where the Buddha was. They dressed in their kaṣāya robes as usual and came before him.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊與諸大眾，前後圍繞，詣尸陀林。
translation: At that time the World-honored One, surrounded by the assembly of bhikṣus, proceeded to the cemetery forest.

source_sentence: 所謂善調伏者，調伏眾圍繞；
translation: The expression well disciplined refers to the discipline of being surrounded by people.

source_sentence: 解脫者，解脫眾圍繞；
translation: Deliverance is that which surrounds the liberated beings.

source_sentence: 安隱者，安隱眾圍繞；
translation: The peaceful one is surrounded by the peaceful beings.

source_sentence: 律儀者，律儀眾圍繞；
translation: Restraint is that which is surrounded by the community of restraint.

source_sentence: 應供者，應供眾圍繞；
translation: Those who should make offerings should be surrounded by those who should make offerings.

source_sentence: 離貪者，離貪眾圍繞；
translation: Being free from craving means to be surrounded by a group of people who are free from craving.

source_sentence: 妙相端直者，妙相端直眾圍繞。
translation: The subtle form that's straight is surrounded by the subtle form that's straight and circumscribed by the crowd.

source_sentence: 猶如牛王，牛眾圍繞；
translation: He was like a king of bulls, surrounded by the herd of cows.

source_sentence: 又如象王，象眾圍繞；
translation: It is also like the case of an elephant king, surrounded by a host of elephants.

source_sentence: 如師子王，眾獸圍繞；
translation: It is like a lion king, surrounded by all kinds of animals.

source_sentence: 如彼鵝王，鵝眾圍繞；
translation: It is like that king of the geese, surrounded by a group of geese.

source_sentence: 如金翅鳥王，金翅鳥眾圍繞；
translation: He was like the king of garuḍas, surrounded by a host of garuḍas.

source_sentence: 如婆羅門，學眾圍繞；
translation: It is like a brahman surrounded by his disciples.

source_sentence: 如大醫王，求療者圍繞；
translation: They are like the great king of physicians, surrounded by those seeking treatment.

source_sentence: 如勇猛將軍，眾圍繞；
translation: He was like a heroic general, surrounded by his troops.

source_sentence: 如大富者，財寶圍繞；
translation: It is like a great wealthy man, surrounded by riches and jewels.

source_sentence: 如大商主，商眾圍繞；
translation: They are like a great merchant lord, surrounded by his merchants.

source_sentence: 如最上首者，多人眾圍繞；
translation: Like the supreme leader, he is surrounded by many people.

source_sentence: 如小國王，臣佐圍繞；
translation: They are like small kings surrounded by their ministers.

source_sentence: 如轉輪王，千子圍繞；
translation: He was like a universal monarch, surrounded by a thousand sons.

source_sentence: 如月天子，眾星圍繞；
translation: It is like the moon deity, surrounded by many stars.

source_sentence: 如日天子，千光圍繞；
translation: It is like the sun, surrounded by a thousand rays of light.

source_sentence: 如持國天王，乾闥婆眾圍繞；
translation: It is as if he were the ruler of a heavenly kingdom, surrounded by an assembly of gandharvas.

source_sentence: 如增長天王，鳩盤茶眾圍繞；
translation: Suppose there is a celestial king growing larger, surrounded by a multitude of kumbhāṇḍas.

source_sentence: 如廣目天王，龍眾圍繞；
translation: He was like the king of the wide-eyed celestial kings, surrounded by a host of dragons.

source_sentence: 如多聞天王，夜叉眾圍繞；
translation: He was like the well-versed celestial king, surrounded by a host of yakṣas.

source_sentence: 如毘摩質多羅阿修羅王，阿修羅眾圍繞；
translation: It is like the case of the asura king Vimalacitra, surrounded by an assembly of asuras.

source_sentence: 如帝釋天主，三十三天眾圍繞；
translation: They are like Indra, the lord of the gods, surrounded by the thirty-three celestial beings.

source_sentence: 如大梵王，梵眾圍繞；
translation: They are like the great Brahma king, surrounded by a host of Brahmas.

source_sentence: 如底彌囉，魚現大海中；
translation: It is as if a fish were to appear in the great ocean, like water lily.

source_sentence: 如靉靆雲將降大雨，周匝諸雲皆悉圍繞。
translation: It's like a cloud of silk that's about to rain down a great deal of rain, surrounded by clouds.

source_sentence: 如來諸根，調柔善順，威儀端儼，離缺失相，如大象王七支拄地平正圓滿，
translation: The Tathāgata’s faculties are gentle and good-natured. He has a dignified demeanor that is free of signs of weariness, resembling the shape of a great elephant king [holding] seven limbs on the ground, even and full.

source_sentence: 離諸過失。
translation: They're free of faults and errors.

source_sentence: 如來具足三十二相、八十隨好，殊妙莊嚴，清淨體相，無能勝者，圓光熾盛，
translation: The Tathāgata is endowed with the thirty-two marks and eighty-eight secondary signs, marvelously beautifully adorned, pure in essence and characteristics that cannot be outshone.

source_sentence: 廣大照耀，如千日中一光明現。
translation: Vast and vast, it shines like a single ray of light that appears in a thousand days.

source_sentence: 又如寶山高顯而出，一切最勝，普遍賢善，十力四無所畏，三不護三念住，
translation: “Furthermore, it is like a mountain of jewels that emerges high and lofty, supreme in all respects, universally good and virtuous, with the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, three unguarded states, and three abodes of mindfulness.

source_sentence: 及大悲等，諸功德法，皆悉具足。
translation: They are all endowed with the qualities of great compassion, etc.

source_sentence: 是時，復有無數諸苾芻眾，及無數百千人眾，周匝圍繞，隨佛行詣尸陀林中。
translation: At the time, there were also countless congregations of monks and countless hundreds of thousands of people surrounding them, following the Buddha's path to the cemetery.

source_sentence: 佛所行時，有十八種法，而可稱讚。
translation: When the Buddha practiced, there were 18 kinds of dharmas that could be praised.

source_sentence: 何等十八？
translation: What are the eighteen?

source_sentence: 一、無火怖；
translation: The first is the absence of fear of fire.

source_sentence: 二、無水怖；
translation: The second is the fear of not being afraid of water.

source_sentence: 三、無師子怖；
translation: 3. The absence of the fear of lions.

source_sentence: 四、無虎怖；
translation: The fourth is the absence of fear of tigers.

source_sentence: 五、無海難怖；
translation: The fifth is that there is no ocean of fear.

source_sentence: 六、無他軍怖；
translation: The sixth is fearlessness in regard to the army of others.

source_sentence: 七、無賊盜怖；
translation: The seventh is freedom from the fear of thieves and robbers.

source_sentence: 八、無王難怖；
translation: The eighth is the absence of sovereignty and fearlessness.

source_sentence: 九、無惡人怖；
translation: The ninth is the absence of fear of bad persons.

source_sentence: 十、無關稅津渡道路等怖；
translation: The tenth fear is the absence of customs duties, taxes, ferries, roads, and other fears.

source_sentence: 十一、無人怖；
translation: The eleventh is that there is no fear of anyone.

source_sentence: 十二、無非人怖；
translation: 12. There is no fear of those who are not people.

source_sentence: 十三、無非時怖；
translation: The thirteenth is the absence of fear at ungodly moments.

source_sentence: 十四、天眼天耳如實見聞；
translation: 14. The divine eye and divine ear see and hear as they really are.

source_sentence: 十五、施設光明廣大照耀；
translation: The fifteenth was the vast illumination of the exposition of buddha-teachings.

source_sentence: 十六、於法自在；
translation: The sixteenth is unimpededness in regard to doctrine.

source_sentence: 十七、於人自在；
translation: 17. Unimpededness with regard to people.

source_sentence: 十八、無病惱等。
translation: 18. The absence of illnesses and afflictions, etc.

source_sentence: 如是善法，佛所行時，皆悉具足。
translation: Thus, these good qualities are fully present when the Buddha practices them.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有無數百千天人，各各來集，隨從世尊，往尸陀林，觀佛世尊所應作事。
translation: At the time, there were also countless hundreds of thousands of gods and humans, each assembled, followed the Bhagavān, went to the cemetery forest, and observed what the Bhagavān should do.

source_sentence: 佛說光明童子因緣經卷第一
translation: Foshuo fongguangming gongzi yining jing, vol. 1
